<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

The bulk of LLVM&#39;s object model consists of values, which comprise a very rich type hierarchy.

<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> essentially represents <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">llvm::Value</a>. There is a rich hierarchy of classes within this type. Depending on the instance obtained, not all APIs are available.

Callers can determine the type of an <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> by calling the LLVMIsA&#42; family of functions (e.g. LLVMIsAArgument()). These functions are defined by a macro, so it isn&#39;t obvious which are available by looking at the Doxygen source code. Instead, look at the source definition of LLVM&#95;FOR&#95;EACH&#95;VALUE&#95;SUBCLASS and note the list of value names given. These value names also correspond to classes in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">llvm::Value</a> hierarchy.
